thread.title: Bayern Munich 8-0 Hamburg: Carlo Ancelotti celebrates 1000th game as a manager in sensational style
thread.title_full: Bayern Munich 8-0 Hamburg: Carlo Ancelotti celebrates 1000th game as a manager in sensational style

author: Alex Richards
title: Bayern Munich 8-0 Hamburg: Carlo Ancelotti celebrates 1000th game as a manager in sensational style
text:
Lewandowski helped himself to a hattrick (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Bayern Munich celebrated Carlo Ancelotti’s 1000th game in management with an 8-0 destruction of Hamburg. 
Die Roten dominated from first to last at the Allianz Arena, as HSV once again surrendered tamely at the home of the German champions. 
In their last six home meetings with HSV, Bayern had helped themselves to 36 goals, in a run including a 9-2 success and an 8-0 victory in February 2015. 
And in their first home match since putting Arsenal to the sword in the Champions League, Bayern romped to victory. Lewandowski, Muller and Alaba were all on the scoresheet (Photo: REUTERS) Arturo Vidal fired home the opener (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Read More Ancelotti reaches 1,000 games as manager - and gets a deliciously odd present 
Robert Lewandowski helped himself to a hat-trick, including one penalty, as they maintained their five point lead over RB Leipzig, 3-1 winners over Köln at the top of the table. 
Arturo Vidal put Bayern in front, driving home after a clever touch from Thomas Muller before Lewandowski’s penalty made it 2-0 after 24 minutes. 
Lewandowski helped himself to a second three minutes before the break, and then the league’s top scorer made it 19 Bundesliga goals and 28 in all competitions in the 54th minute, when rolling confidently past a helpless Rene Adler. Within two minutes, David Alaba had made it five. Lewandowski coolly converts (Photo: REUTERS) 
HSV could have been forgiven for thinking that would be that, particularly as Ancelotti replaced Lewandowski with Portuguese starlet Renato Sanches and withdrew the outstanding Thiago to hand French winger Kingsley Coman minutes. 
Coman has endured a difficult second season in Bavaria, but the 20-year-old soon made his presence felt, scoring twice in nine minutes. 
First he evaded a Johannes Djourou challenge to side-foot home from close range, before thrashing past Adler in the 69th minute as the ball sat up kindly on the edge of the box. Ancelotti gets a hug from Philipp Lahm (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Coman came off the bench to bag twice (Photo: REUTERS) Robben does what Robben does (Photo: REUTERS) 
Bayern had seemingly declared that was that against a Hamburg side who looked utterly shell-shocked, only for Robben to have the final say, the Dutch winger giving Mergim Mavraj twisted blood before curling home in typical fashion. 
That made it 44 goals for Bayern in the last seven meetings between the old rivals in Munich and while inching Bayern closer to the title pushes Der Dino into the very heart of the division’s relegation battle. Other Bundesliga results
